title: ‘The Last Waltz’ Review: Slow Fade
sub_head: Martin Scorsese’s now-restored 1978 film of The Band’s farewell concert has a strange grandeur
body: From “Jazz on a Summer’s Day” (1959) to “Woodstock” (1970) and beyond, many of the best-known concert films use cinéma vérité techniques to evoke the full concert experience. In these films and others, cameras point every which way to capture the artists on the stage and the crowd below.
